newsitem.title: INDIA: Yield on Indian 91-day t-bill eases to 10.11 pct.
newsitem.headline: Yield on Indian 91-day t-bill eases to 10.11 pct.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said it set a cut-off price of 97.54 rupees at the weekly auction of 91-day treasury bills on Friday.
Dealers said the yield worked out to 10.11 percent, compared to 10.20 percent at last week's auction.
The RBI said it accepted 17 of 42 competitive bids (including six partial allotments) for 47.28 billion rupees. Partial allotment to two non-competitive bids amounted to 271.9 million rupees.
The total applications received in competitive bids amounted to 9.68 billion rupees.
There was no devolvement on RBI or the primary dealers.
